clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Performance on Virtual Reality Visual Field Devices as Compared to Standard of Care
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Performance on Virtual Reality Visual Field Devices as Compared to Standard of Care

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to study the effectiveness and patient experience when measuring visual fields using virtual reality goggles.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of VRVF compared to SAP
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of VRVF will be determined by comparing Hodapp Anderson Parrish (HAP) Scores, which assess the severity of visual field defects, to those of SAP

primary_outcome.measure: Specificity of VRVF compared to SAP
primary_outcome.description: Specificity of VRVF will be determined by comparing Hodapp Anderson Parrish (HAP) Scores, which assess the severity of visual field defects, to those of SAP

secondary_outcome.description: Variability of the mean deviation scores obtained from VRVF and SAP

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adults with Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma
arm_group.description: Adults with Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma, who have previously had standard automated perimetry (SAP) and will receive virtual reality visual field (VRVF) as part of the standard of care
Visual Field Naive Adults will receive SAP and VRVF

arm_group.description: Children with Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma, who have previously had SAP and will receive VRVF as part of the standard of care

Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma participants, who have previously had SAP and will receive VRVF at their home

intervention.description: A head-mounted perimeter with a wireless remote connected to a laptop that monitors responses

Children with Glaucoma or Suspected Glaucoma

study_pop.textblock: Participants who are glaucoma or glaucoma suspect who are being seen at Bascom Palmer Eye Institute and/or healthy individuals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- Any individual who is physically able to take a virtual reality visual field test
- Patients who either have glaucoma, are glaucoma suspects, or have a strong family history of glaucoma, or have other visual field defects, and normal individual
- Age: Individuals who are old enough to comprehend the instructions and procedures (1-90)
Exclusion:
- Adults unable to consent, prisoners
- Participants who are too tired to take a visual field test
- Participants who refuse to consent
- Individuals who are functionally unable to use VRVF
